description:
**Tool Overview**:

A generic PowerShell function designed for inspecting the contents of a WinRE.wim file to determine if it is patched against specific CVEs, namely CVE-2022-4109 and CVE-2024-20666.

***Functionality***:
This PowerShell function accepts the location of the WinRE.wim file as a parameter. It leverages the reagentc.exe tool to gather necessary information about the WinRE environment. By doing so, it allows system administrators to verify the applied updates and ensure that the cumulative Safe OS update has addressed relevant vulnerabilities. The function is coded to work seamlessly on Windows 10 and Windows Server 2022.

***Usage Example***:
To run the function, execute it in a PowerShell session, providing the appropriate path to the WinRE.wim file. The function will return the necessary information regarding the patch status and any actionable insights.

The detailed explanation for this Tool is provided in the Fix description.
